Given the recent developments in both experiment-driven and computation-driven complex structure solution, we now have the right mise en place for a truly integrated methodology that promises the most realistic structural models possible. Two particular challenges remain: one is the computational difficulty of accounting for the contribution of entropy (doable, but slow), and the second is the trickier problem that complex materials need not be equilibrium phases.
